Member Enumeration Documentation

enum glr::shaders::IShader::BindType

The different types of data that can be bound to a shader from glr. This data is bound in the shader using a tag, such as ''. When the shader is parsed, the name of the variable that the '' binding is associated with is stored. Later, when we bind a shader and want to bind, for example, light data, we can reference this stored shader variable name, and bind our light data to it. This way, we don't have to hard code any shader variable names.

Enumerator:
BIND_TYPE_NONE 
BIND_TYPE_LOCATION

Member Function Documentation

virtual void glr::shaders::IShader::bind ( )
pure virtual

Binds the current IShader object to OpenGL. This is used when compiling a shader program.

Implemented in glr::shaders::GlslShader.
